snippet: The downing of the Syrian military aircraft was said to be the first such attack by fighters from the Islamic State group.
abstract: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants say they have shot down a Syrian military aircraft over their stronghold in northern city of Raqqa, in what antigovernment activists say is a first for the group.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva; an employee of The New York Times from Raqqa, Syria; and Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: The downing of the Syrian military aircraft was said to be the first such attack by fighters from the Islamic State group.

headline.main: Syrian Plane Shot Down as Attacks by Groups Intensify
headline.print_headline: Syrian Plane Shot Down as Attacks by Groups Intensify

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
